t: A Calm Resolve to Wait for the Salvation of God
To the Chief Musician. To Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
Truly*pn my soul silently waits*i for God; From*ld Him comes*i my salvation.
He*ld only is*i my rock and my salvation; He*ild is*i my defense; I*ld shall not be greatly moved.
How*ln long will you attack a man? You*ld shall be slain, all of you, Like*ld a leaning wall and a tottering fence.
They*ld only consult to cast him*i down from his high position; They*ld delight in lies; They*ld bless with their mouth, But*ld they curse inwardly. Selah*ipg
My*pn soul, wait silently for God alone, For*ld my expectation is*i from Him.
He*ld only is*i my rock and my salvation; He*ild is*i my defense; I*ld shall not be moved.
In*ld God is*i my salvation and my glory; The*ld rock of my strength, And*ild my refuge, is*i in God.
Trust*ln in Him at all times, you people; Pour*ld out your heart before Him; God*ld is*i a refuge for us. Selah*ipg
Surely*pn men of low degree are*i a vapor, Men*ld of high degree are*i a lie; If*ld they are weighed on the scales, They*ld are*i altogether lighter*i than vapor.
Do*ld not trust in oppression, Nor*ld vainly hope in robbery; If*ld riches increase, Do*ld not set your*i heart on*i them.*i
God*ln has spoken once, Twice*ld I have heard this: That*ld power belongs*i to God.
Also*ld to You, O Lord, belongs*i mercy; For*ld You render to each one according to his work.
